channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Nearly all the litter bins in the park need emptying, 1st September
item.description:
Please can all the litter bins be emptied as most of them are now overflowing and litter is accumulating around the base of two of them. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, London

item.title: 3 way traffic lights not working properly- dangerous, 1st September
item.description:
Traffic building up both ways on College Road and Kingswood drive. Drivers getting inpatient and honking as lights aren’t working properly. Drivers bypassing the lights in 3 directions after waiting a long time for a green light. Risk of cars crashing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blight on the road, 1st September
item.description:
Tree outside 45 Garden Avenue,, contractors cleared the growth under trees today did a good job but did not do this tree, It is the worst in the road , lovely trees in the road but I have a crab apple tree not fit for a public path, Belongs in an orchard not a road or pavement, I am at my wits end with the mess the droppings cause and to top it off it has not been attended to , The tree is half dead anyway it needs to be removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garden Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing traffic signal on Queensway B411, 1st September
item.description:
I recently reported that the traffic light on the right-hand side of the road is missing (FixMyStreet reference: 7990648). According to your response, an inspection was carried out but no defects were found. I’m struggling to understand this outcome, as the pole on the right clearly has fixings indicating that a signal was once installed there. While the signal may have been missing for some time, it remains important that it be replaced. As shown in the attached photos, the remaining signal on the left-hand side is obscured by a hanging basket, making it difficult for drivers and cyclists to see. This needs to be reassessed. The missing traffic signal on the right side is necessary for visibility and safety.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 114, Queensway, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: The carriageway requires a total tidied up, 1st September
item.description:
The whole length of the carriageway requires a total overhaul as there is over grown weeds and plants, builders rubber etc. Road signs and bollards need to be replaced and maintained to a safety standard, the carriageway is an eye sore and should be maintained regularly and made safely.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Hill, Bexley, London

item.title: There has been a warning cone placed near Gravel Hill school, 1st September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Hill, Bexley, London

item.title: Illegal parking, 1st September
item.description:
This again ! Illegal parking. Such a shame, it has been much clearer the last few months but this particular vehicle is parking like this a lot ! I really hope its stopped before other vehicles think its OK and we get the 'near miss' chaos again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Edmunds Road, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
